nodes.long_description:
# ¡El juego de combate aéreo que estabas esperando!
Ruge hacia el **Dawn of Jets** donde el poder moderno se combina con el combate aéreo clásico. Toma el control de los aviones más emblemáticos de la historia mientras vuelas y ábrete camino a través del juego de vuelo más realista, intenso y hermoso de Quest.
{1264153841897725}
# ¡Realista pero fácil de volar!
El modelo de vuelo con física súper fluida admite despegues, aterrizajes, giros, bucles e incluso lanzamientos y trampas de portaaviones.

► **Carrera**: Docenas de misiones hechas a mano, ¡Sin repetición algorítmica!

► **Desafíos**: Asciende en las tablas de clasificación en desafíos de combate, carreras y aviación.

► **Vuelo libre**: Relájate mientras exploras el vasto y detallado paisaje.

# ¡Increíbles cabinas interactivas!
Palanca interactiva, acelerador, flaps, interruptores, instrumentos, sistemas de armas y más, todo al alcance de la mano.
{2169905120170965}
# Jets clásicos
10 jets clásicos y más en camino. ¡Conviértete en uno con tu máquina!
{10057575847692363}
# ¡Paisaje precioso!
Impresionantes paisajes fotorrealistas con miles de árboles, edificios y detalles.
{1264086195281056}
**Dawn of Jets** es fácil de aprender para principiantes, pero lo suficientemente profundo como para que lo disfruten los fanáticos de los simuladores de vuelo.  ¡Esperamos que aprecies la atención al detalle, el amor y el cuidado que ponemos en este juego!
nodes.short_description: Toma el control de los aviones de combate más emblemáticos de la historia en este juego de combate aéreo, el primero en su tipo, en Quest.  Diez aviones detallados, amplios escenarios y docenas de intensas misiones se combinan en un mundo inmersivo en 3D para producir una increíble experiencia de realidad virtual.

nodes.long_description:
# The Air Combat Game You've Been Waiting For!
Roar into the **Dawn of Jets** where modern power meets classic air combat. Take control of history's most iconic jets as you fly and fight your way through the most realistic, intense and beautiful flying game on Quest.

{1038983140901911}
# Realistic Yet Easy To Fly!
Super-smooth physics flight model supports takeoffs, landings, rolls, loops, and even carrier launches and traps.

► **Career**: Dozens of hand-crafted missions - no algorithmic repetition!

► **Challenges**: Climb the leaderboards in combat, race and aviation challenges.

► **Free Flight**: Relax while exploring the vast, detailed scenery.

# Amazing Interactive Cockpits!
Interactive stick, throttle, flaps, switches, instruments, weapons systems and more - all at fingertip control.
{418115644563500}

# Classic Jets
10 classic jets with more on the way. Become one with your machine!
{839666010989519}

# Gorgeous Scenery!
Eye-popping photo-realistic scenery with thousands of trees, buildings and details.
{1858158978003671}

**Dawn of Jets** is easy to learn for beginners, but in-depth enough for core flight simulator fans to enjoy.  We hope you appreciate the attention to detail, love and care that we put into this game!
nodes.short_description:
Take control of history's most iconic jet fighters in this first-of-it's-kind air combat game on the Quest.  10 detailed aircraft, expansive scenery and dozens of intense missions are brought together in an immersive 3D world to produce an amazing VR experience.  

Easy to fly, yet with enough realism to keep flight enthusiasts coming back, you may not have believed a game like this was possible on the Quest!

Take control of history's most iconic jet fighters in this first-of-it's-kind air combat game on the Quest.  10 detailed aircraft, expansive scenery and dozens of intense missions are brought together in an immersive 3D world to produce an amazing VR experience.  

Easy to fly, yet with enough realism to keep flight enthusiasts coming back, you may not have believed a game like this was possible on the Quest!

nodes.change_log:
New
*Spanish Localization: The vast majority of the game has been translated into Spanish (Thanks Yvette!)  Audio voice-overs will not be translated.
*Sticky Grip: When enabled, your hand will remain locked to the stick after grabbing it and releasing the grab button.  Clicking the grab button again unlocks your hand from the stick. This is designed to reduce arm fatigue.
*Adverse Yaw: Simulates the jet’s tendency to yaw in the opposite direction of the change in roll.  Enabling this feature simulates this effect, requiring rudder input to “coordinate” your turns.  This is a work-in-progress.
*Yaw-Induced Roll: Simulates roll and nose-dip encountered during yaw motion - this is primarily due to the fuselage blocking the oncoming wind from the “inboard” wing.  This is a work-in-progress.
*Please Note:  Because these jets have fairly symmetrical airfoils, very little dihedral, and very little pitch-up incidence relative to the fuselage, the Adverse Yaw and Yaw-Induced Roll are not going to be nearly as pronounced as they would be in light civilian aircraft.  Also note that the CoL and CoM are much closer together which also tends to reduce these effects.
*Stick Throw Factor: This setting controls how far the virtual stick (not thumbstick) needs to be moved to produce full aileron/elevator deflection.  Reducing the setting all the way causes the normal stick throw to be cut approximately in half.
*View Smoothing: View smoothing can now be disabled, if desired.  View smoothing simulates a person’s natural inclination to move their head/eyes to “smooth out” dramatic movements - typically roll.  For most people, View Smoothing helps to reduce VR-induced motion sickness, but some people may be bothered by it.
*Nav Lights:  In anticipation of multiplayer, most aircraft now have switches to control the red/green/white navigation lights - also known as running lights   On some jets, this also controls an anti-collision flasher.
*Increase Subsequent-Play Earnings: Missions now pay out 25% of the original value on subsequent runs in order to make the “grind” easier.
*Quick Access Buttons:  Pause menu now has buttons to raise gear and unfold wings as those controls are difficult to reach on some jets for players on couch/armchair.
*Callsign UI: In anticipation of multiplayer, added a UI to enter your callsign.  Go to “skins” menu and click the new button.
*Callsign Decal: In anticipation of multiplayer, player’s callsign is now decaled onto the side of their jet.
*Landing Lights: Most jets have a landing light that will illuminate nearby scenery in front of the jet.  This is a work in progress, and not all objects respond to the light.  Work in progress.
*Bomb Training: This mission has been moved to the F-80C, which has a bombing reticle.  Hopefully this will make things easier for new users.
*First Mission Reward: To compensate for the relocation of Bomb Training, the reward for “Cockpit Familiarization and Takeoff” has increased from $1000 to $3000.
*Support for USB Controllers (HOTAS): Added general support for USB input devices.  Please note that we are significantly limited by both Android and Unity as to what devices, and what input elements on those devices can be detected.  We hope to improve this in the future but overcoming the existing hardware and OS limitations will require a significant amount of work for the very small percent of our customers that use these devices.  (Yes, we know you love your fancy HOTAS, but on Quest, less than 1% of our users have requested this support.)
*Ability to Remap Quest Controllers: The Quest controllers can now be remapped as desired.  This is a work-in-progress.  The UI isn’t “pretty”, but uses a standard system that customers have likely encountered in other games.
*Complete Overhaul of Input System: Mostly internal, the input system has been re-done to support new features and make it easier to add switches and levers to the jets.
*Nav Lights: Add switches to all aircraft for navigation lights.
*Landing Light: Add switches to all aircraft for landing lights.
*Radio RX Dial: Rework selector switch in anticipation of multiplayer.
*Radio TX Dial: Rework selector switch in anticipation of multiplayer.
*Rework Finger Trigger Gun Fire: Finger triggers should fire the gun as long as the finger is not hovering over a VR control.  Previously, triggers would only fire the gun if the stick was being gripped.
Fixed
*Meteor Flight Hours: Fixed achievement graphics.
*Engine Start Switch: Hit zones larger on all aircraft.
*Button Hit Zones: Increased on many controls.
*Meteor Flight Hours: Enabled medals in game data.
*Missing Indicators: Fixed a problem where quitting a mission could cause indicators to not appear in the next mission flown.
*Full Pattern Trap: Fixed messaging.
*Chopper Convoy: Fixed references to missing data.
*Jet Skin Mapping: Many small fixes to texture mapping on the planes.
*Target Pointers: Fixed problem where opening the pause menu may have deactivated target pointers and/or indicators.
*Smoke Trail Emissions: Adjusted on all jets.
*Cockpit Emission Maps: Cleaned up some errant glows on several cockpit lighting maps.
*MG-15 Gear Indicators: Fixed.
*F-84 Cockpit Text: Fixed typo.
*JF-3 Description: Fixed typo.
*Chopper Convoy: Fixed problem where helicopters would crash into mountains due to waypoint loop issue.
*F.3: Fix bad seam in cockpit texture.
